original_title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Paxton Street
text:
St. Pauls Avenue, adjoining the N. W. corner of Paxton (Church) Street, showing the old St. Pauls (P.E.) Memorial Church. The building was erected in 1834. A new brick edifice was erected in 1868 at the S. E. corner of St. Pauls Avenue and Clinton Street, and the old structure abandoned.

Copy from photograph by J. Loeffler
From P. L. Sperr Collection

1870's (?)

original_title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Clinton Street
text:
(1)
225 St. Pauls Avenue, south of the S.E. corner of Clinton Street, showing St. Pauls Protestant Episcopal Memorial Church. The building was erected in 1868.
May 28, 1927

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The parsonage of St. Pauls Memorial Church, adjoining the church to the south.
May 28, 1927

P. L. Sperr
